DOC.HEADLINE: BRIEFLY : TRADE
DOC.TEXT: Japan May File Charges in Bid-Rigging Cases : Japan ' s anti-monopoly watchdog is poised to file rare criminal charges against nine electronics firms and their executives , alleging bid-rigging going back as far as January , Japanese media said.The Fair Trade Commission has been investigating suspicions that the firms , which include industry leaders , repeatedly rigged bids and arranged in_advance the winners of contracts for water_supply and sewage_systems for regional governments . A commission spokesman declined to comment on the reports . The five largest firms allegedly involved are Toshiba , Hitachi , Mitsubishi Electric , Fuji Electric and Meidensha .
